content.description: Sit started match in the large sidepull flake. Move up to pockets (a fun mule kick drop knee may help) and a large undercling. Use a crimp seem in the dihedral and high feet to move up until you can move left out from under the roof to a committing and balancy high step/ mantle to topout.
content.protection: Two pads, this fellah is tall.
content.location: This slab line starts below the left side of the roof on the main face of the Red Roof Boulder (facing away from the road).

content.description: Stand start the slab with the help of a hip height undercling and other features. Move straight up through the solid, but hollow sounding rock chunk with a great pinch at the bottom. Continue up to some sloping ledges just right of the roof and trend right to a tall, mellow topout.
content.protection: A pad or two. Flat landing, but tall.
content.location: This line is the right most climb on the face of the Red Roof boulder.

climbs.name: Dr. Boinko's Homeopathic Bed Bug Remedy

content.description: Start on a gaston crimp with a duo pocket directly above the crimp. Move up to crimps in the dihedral and use left slopers to gain the large pocket on the right. Find crimps to move up the the large sloping shelf and traverse slightly right to the shared topout
content.protection: Two pads since it is tall. Flat landing.
content.location: This line follows the second dihedral from the right (the one with the pocket on it) to the right of the roof on the face of the Red Roof Boulder.
